briefdescription.para: wxWeakRefDynamic<T> is a template class for weak references that is used in the same way as wxWeakRef<T>.

detaileddescription.para: The only difference is that wxWeakRefDynamic defaults to using dynamic_cast for establishing the object reference (while wxWeakRef defaults to static_cast).

So, wxWeakRef will detect a type mismatch during compile time and will have a little better run-time performance. The role of wxWeakRefDynamic is to handle objects which derived type one does not know.

wxWeakRef<T> selects an implementation based on the static type of T. If T does not have wxTrackable statically, it defaults to a mixed- mode operation, where it uses dynamic_cast as the last measure (if available from the compiler and enabled when building wxWidgets). For general cases, wxWeakRef<T> is the better choice.

parameterdescription.para: The type to which the smart pointer points to.

detaileddescription.para: Library:None; this class implementation is entirely header-based.
